intro: Pterocaulon cylindrostachyum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important species such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its upright, often branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Pterocaulon cylindrostachyum thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
